title: Vietnamese Meatballs
description: Sweet and spicy Vietnamese style meatballs made with lean ground turkey.

instructions.step1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees, line baking sheet with parchment
instructions.step2: In a large bowl mix all the meatball ingredients, form into 1 inch balls, place on baking sheet, cook for 20-25 minutes
instructions.step3: Meanwhile in medium bowl mix glaze ingredients, add cooked meatballs and toss gently until coated
instructions.step5: Garnish with chopped peanuts, cilantro and mint

title: Korean Meatballs
description: Sweet and spicy Korean style meatballs made with lean ground turkey.

instructions.step1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees, line baking sheet with parchment
instructions.step2: In a large bowl mix all the meatball ingredients, form into 1 inch balls, place on baking sheet, cook for 20-25 minutes
instructions.step3: Meanwhile in medium bowl mix glaze ingredients, add cooked meatballs and toss gently until coated
instructions.step5: Garnish with chopped chives or thinly sliced green onion tops

title: Korean Meatball Marinara
description: Korean style meatballs in spicy marinara sauce.

item3.ingredient: fresh ginger, peeled and grated or minced

item6.ingredient: Mirin (味醂), Shaoxing wine (紹興酒) or wine vinegar

item10.ingredient: chili powder, Aleppo, ancho or chipotle

instructions.step1: In a large sauce pan, saute onion in olive oil over low heat until translucent
instructions.step2: Add ginger and garlic, saute for a couple minutes
instructions.step3: Add crushed tomatoes and remaining ingredients, stir to mix and cook covered over low heat for 20-30 minutes, stirring as needed to prevent sticking
instructions.step4: In a large bowl combine meatball ingredients, mixing thoroughly, add bread crumbs until desired texture is achieved
instructions.step5: Form into 1 inch balls and lightly brown in non-stick skillet, add to sauce, gently pushing into mixture
instructions.step6: Simmer for another 20-30 minutes stirring gently to keep from sticking
instructions.step8: Garnish with chopped chives or thinly sliced green onion tops

title: Korean Chili Chicken
description: Sweet and spicy Korean style chicken with carrots.

item6.ingredient: fresh ginger, peeled and grated or minced

item7.ingredient: chili powder, or Korean red powder (mild chili powder)

item4.ingredient: Mirin (味醂), Shaoxing wine (紹興酒) or dry sherry

instructions.step1: Combine sauce ingredients in a measuring cup and mix
instructions.step2: Cut chicken into pieces, trimming fat as required, coat with flour in plastic bag
instructions.step3: Add 1 tbsp coconut oil to a wok, then layer onion, carrots, green onion, garlic and ginger
instructions.step4: Add 2 tbsp oil to a large non-stick skillet and preheat over medium heat
instructions.step5: Turn on wok to medium, let onion and carrots cook for 7-8 minutes stirring occasionally and kept covered
instructions.step6: Place chicken into skillet and turn up heat to medium-high
instructions.step7: Add sauce mixture and chili powders, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer while cooking chicken
instructions.step8: Cook chicken until almost done, flipping once and breaking up bunches to ensure even cooking
instructions.step9: Add chicken to mixture, stir to coat evenly, and cook for 2 minutes
instructions.step10: Serve over rice, garnish with sesame seeds and green onion tops

title: Sweet and Spicy Shrimp
description: Stir fry sweet and spicy chili shrimp with mini bell peppers.

item4.ingredient: fresh ginger, peeled and grated or minced

item9.ingredient: Mirin (味醂), Shaoxing wine (紹興酒) or dry sherry

instructions.step1: Peel shrimp under running water, set aside to drain
instructions.step2: Heat coconut oil in wok, add onion and ginger saute for several minutes, add garlic
instructions.step3: In a large skillet, saute peppers in olive oil over medium high heat until edges are browning
instructions.step4: Mix liquids in a small bowl or measuiring cup, add to to wok and bring to a low boil
instructions.step5: Add shrimp, cook for 5 minutes covered, stirring several times to coat shrimp
instructions.step6: Remove from heat, serve over rice or noodles with peppers

title: Tomato Carrot Chicken
description: Savory and spicy Korean style chicken with carrots.

item5.ingredient: fresh ginger, peeled and grated or minced

item9.ingredient: chili powder, or Korean red powder (mild chili powder)

instructions.step1: Cut chicken into pieces, trimming fat as required, coat with flour in plastic bag
instructions.step2: Add 2 tbsp coconut oil to a wok, then layer onion, carrots, green onion, garlic and ginger
instructions.step3: Add 2 tbsp oil to a large non-stick skillet and preheat over medium heat
instructions.step4: Turn on wok to medium, let onion and carrots cook for 7-8 minutes stirring occasionally and kept covered
instructions.step5: Place chicken into skillet and turn up heat to medium-high
instructions.step6: Add sauce ingredients, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer while cooking chicken
instructions.step7: Cook chicken until almost done, flipping once and breaking up bunches to ensure even cooking
instructions.step8: Add chicken to mixture, stir to coat evenly, and cook for 2 minutes
instructions.step9: Serve over rice, garnish with sesame seeds and green onion tops

title: Korean Turkey Crumbles
description: Korean style ground turkey for rice bowls or Kimchi burritos.

item6.ingredient: fresh ginger, peeled and grated or minced

item11.ingredient: Mirin (味醂), Shaoxing wine (紹興酒) or dry sherry

instructions.step1: In a large skillet, saute onion in olive oil over low heat until translucent
instructions.step2: Add meat to pan and cook until browned, flipping and chopping to make crumbles
instructions.step3: Add the rest of the ingredients and mix thoroughly
instructions.step4: Simmer covered for 20-30 minutes, removing lid towards the end if there is extra moisture
instructions.step5: Serve over rice and garnish with thinly sliced green onion tops

instructions.step1: Cut tofu into chunks, and drain on a paper towel
instructions.step2: Place starch into a plastic bag, add tofu and shake to coat
instructions.step3: Add 3 tbsp oil to medium non-stick skillet and preheat over medium heat
instructions.step4: Place tofu into skillet and turn up heat to medium-high
instructions.step5: Meanwhile in another pan, saute onion and garlic until starting to brown
instructions.step6: Add the ketchup, honey, Gochujang and water, bring to a boil
instructions.step7: Mix to coat tofu with sauce, serve over rice and garnish with thinly sliced green onion tops

title: Korean Broiled Salmon
description: Tender salmon fillets broiled to perfection in a spicy Korean inspired marinade.

item4.ingredient: fresh ginger, peeled and grated or minced

item8.ingredient: Mirin (味醂), Shaoxing wine (紹興酒) or dry sherry

instructions.step1: Combine marinade ingredients in a bowl or large zip-lock bag
instructions.step2: Cut salmon into strips, add to marinade and massage until thoroughly coated
instructions.step3: Marinate for at least an hour
instructions.step4: Make a foil boat using 2 layers with edges turned up enough to keep marinade and juices contained
instructions.step5: Heat grill with broiler on high, and cook for 3-5 minutes until salmon flakes (130 degrees)
instructions.step6: An oven using broiler setting for 3-5 minutes works well too
instructions.step7: Let rest for a few minutes before serving over rice with green onion or sesame seed garnish

notes: This cooks fast so try roasted garlic or microwaving garlic cloves for a minute if it's too raw.
